vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: inefficient-state-variable-increment
vulnerability_findings.message: <x> += <y> costs more gas than <x> = <x> + <y> for state variables.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Using multiple require statements is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: locked-ether
vulnerability_findings.message:
Contract locking ether found in MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock.sol:
	Contract MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock has payable functions:
	 - fallback (MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock.sol#125-132)
	But does not have a function to withdraw the ether

vulnerability_findings.name: assembly
vulnerability_findings.message:
MultiSigWallet._externalCall uses assembly (MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock.sol#292-318)
	- MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock.sol#302-316

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: MultiSigWallet.addOwner (MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock.sol#160-170) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: MultiSigWallet.removeOwner (MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock.sol#174-191) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: MultiSigWallet.replaceOwner (MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock.sol#196-212) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: MultiSigWallet.submitTransaction (MultiSigWalletWithTimeLock.sol#230-236) should be declared external
